meanings.definition: Have enough money or resources to buy or pay for something.
meanings.sent1: She is affording a new dress for the party.
meanings.sent2: They are affording a vacation this summer.
meanings.sent3: He found a wallet affording him the chance to buy the concert tickets.
meanings.sent4: The scholarship afforded her the opportunity to attend college.
meanings.sent5: Affording a car seemed like a distant dream until he got a raise.

meanings.sent1: The company is affording training to all employees.
meanings.sent2: The charity is affording food to those in need.
meanings.sent3: The garden is affording an abundance of fresh vegetables this year.
meanings.sent4: The library affords a quiet place to study.
meanings.sent5: Affording assistance to others is a noble act of kindness.

meanings.definition: Offer or grant an opportunity or possibility.
meanings.sent1: The new program is affording students a chance to study abroad.
meanings.sent2: The job affords flexible working hours.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected holiday affords a spontaneous adventure.
meanings.sent4: The promotion afforded him the opportunity to lead the team.
meanings.sent5: Affording new experiences enriches our lives in unexpected ways.
